intro: Centaurea koenigii, commonly known as love-in-a-mist, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, spiky blue or purple flowers that rise above delicate, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. Centaurea koenigii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
